chapter.p: 1Joel 3:1–21 in the English Bible is 4:1–21 in the Hebrew Bible For look! In those days, and in that time, when I will returnOr “restore” the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem, 2I will gather all the nations, and I will bring them down to the valley of Jehoshaphat, and I will argue a case against themLiterally “a matter with them” there concerning my people and my inheritance Israel whom they have scattered among the nations, and my land that they have divided. 3For my people they cast lots,Hebrew “lot” and they tradedLiterally “gave” the male child for the prostitute, and the female child they sold for wine and they drank it.

4What are you to me, O Tyre and O Sidon, and all of the regions of Philistia? Are you repaying to me what is deserved? If you are recompensing me, I will return swiftly and quickly what you deserve on your head! 5For you have taken my silver and my gold, and my beautiful treasures you have carried into your temples. 6And the sons of Judah and Jerusalem you sold to the sons of the Greeks, in order to remove them from their border. 7Look! I am rousing them from the place where you have sold them, and I will return what you deserve on your head! 8I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hand of the children of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans and to a nation far away, for Yahweh has spoken.
chapter.pericope: Yahweh’s Judgment in the Valley of Jehoshaphat

ul.li1: 9Proclaim this among the nations:
ul.li2: Prepare for war!Literally “Sanctify a battle”
ul.li1: let them approach and come up;
ul.li2: let all the men of war approach.
ul.li1: 10Beat your cutting tools of iron into swords
ul.li2: and your pruning hooks into spears;
ul.li3: let the weakling say, ‘I am a mighty warrior!’
ul.li1: 11Hurry and come,
ul.li2: all the nations, from all around,
ul.li1: Bring down your mighty warriors, O Yahweh!
12Let the nations be roused and let them come up
ul.li2: to the valley of Jehoshaphat,
ul.li1: for there I will sit to judge
ul.li2: all the nations from all around.
ul.li1: 13Send forth the sickle,
ul.li2: for the harvest is ripe!
ul.li1: for the winepress is full!
ul.li2: The vats overflow,
ul.li1: 14Commotion, commotion
ul.li2: in the valley of decision!
ul.li1: For the day of Yahweh is near
ul.li2: in the valley of decision!
ul.li1: 15The sun and the moon grow dark,
ul.li2: and the stars have withheldLiterally “gathered” their splendor.
ul.li1: 16And Yahweh roars from Zion;
ul.li2: from Jerusalem he utters his voice,
ul.li1: and the heavens and the earth shake.
But Yahweh is a refuge for his people,
ul.li2: and a protection for the children of Israel.
ul.li1: 17And you will know that I, Yahweh your God,
ul.li2: am dwelling in Zion, my holy mountain.
ul.li1: And Jerusalem will be a place of holiness,
ul.li2: and strangers will pass through it no longer.
ul.li1: 18And it will happen on that day;
the mountains will drip new wine,
ul.li2: and the hills will flow with milk,
and all the channels of Judah will flow with water.
ul.li1: A spring from the house of Yahweh will come forth,
ul.li2: and it will water the valley of Acacia Trees.Or “the wadi Shittim”
ul.li1: 19Egypt will become a desolation,
ul.li2: and Edom will become a desolate desert,Literally “desert of desolation”
ul.li1: because of the violence they did against the children of Judah,
ul.li2: in whose land they have shed innocent blood.
ul.li1: 20But Judah will be inhabited forever,
ul.li2: and Jerusalem for all generations.Or “for each generation”
ul.li1: 21I will cleanse their bloodguiltLiterally “I will not leave unpunished their blood” that I did not cleanse,Or “I did not consider innocent”
ul.li2: for Yahweh is dwelling in Zion.
